articles.title: Fear spreads along with cases of coronavirus
articles.description: The number of coronavirus cases is rising worldwide, and so is the level of anxiety and fear surrounding the disease. Dr. Bethany Marshall, a behavioral expert and psychologist, joined CBSN from Los Angeles to discuss coronavirus concerns.

articles.title: North Korea fires two projectiles after months-long pause in tests
articles.description: No word on what they were but firing comes after break possibly related to coronavirus concerns
articles.content:
Seoul, South Korea — North Korea fired two unidentified projectiles into its eastern sea on Monday as it begins to resume weapons demonstrations after a months-long hiatus that could have been forced by the coronavirus crisis in Asia.

articles.author: Caitlin O'Kane
articles.title: Cab drivers infected with coronavirus from tourists
articles.description: "I don't have a bad feeling against tourists or the Chinese. I drive a taxi, tourists are my breadbasket," the driver said
articles.content:
A taxi driver in Thailand likely caught the coronavirus from Chinese tourists who were passengers in his cab. The tourists were coughing but wearing face masks, the driver said. He still caught the virus, despite the masks. 
The 51-year-old driver started ex… [+5795 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Tourism decreases in Italy as coronavirus spreads
articles.description: As the number of coronavirus cases in Italy soared by 50% over the weekend, fewer tourists are visiting popular attractions. Charlie D’Agata reports from Rome, where people have even been worried about the health of Pope Francis.

articles.content: In South Korea, a staggering two-thirds of the more than 4,000 people who have now tested positive for coronavirus are tied to the same church. In fact, Lee Man-hee, the leader of Shincheonji Church, got on his knees and bowed to the ground at a news conferen… [+4393 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Coronavirus death toll rises in U.S.
articles.description: Health officials in Washington state announced four new deaths bringing the total to six in the U.S. Researchers say the virus may have been circulating in the area for weeks undetected and more cases are likely. Jonathan Vigliotti reports.

articles.title: CDC issues multiple travel warnings over coronavirus
articles.description: The CDC is warning Americans to avoid nonessential travel to China, Italy, South Korea and Iran due to concerns about coronavirus. CBS News transportation correspondent Kris Van Cleave joined CBSN AM with more.

articles.title: How coronavirus affects the human body
articles.description: At least 89 people in the United States have been sickened with coronavirus across 12 states. Dr. Tara Narula joins “CBS This Morning” to talk about how infectious the disease is and how it affects the human body.

articles.title: Coronavirus misinformation spreads rapidly on social media
